URGENT 
ASSISTANCE
REPUBLIC OF PHILIPPINES
DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION &
COMMUNICATIONS
LAND TRANSPORTATION OFFICE
EAST AVE QUEZON CITY
FROM CHUA ERNESTO .
RE: CONTRACT AGREEMENT.

Dear
Friend,

I wish
to acknowledge and recognize your importance in this business transaction which
will take us only one month. I am a member of contract awarding committee which
I was the chairman.

A
contract was awarded to foreign company to buy transport vehicles for my
country awarded in the year 2001, the contract was (40) Million, United State
dollars but been a contract awarding committee chairman I over inflated in to
the tone of (60)Million United State Dollars, the work have been completed and
the company have been paid by Phillipine transportation communication and they
have gone, what is left now is (20) Million, United State Dollars which was
kept in one of th e Finance/Security Company set up by the Republic of
philippine that is in charge of paying foreign contractors.

I need
your assistance to assist me conclude this golden opportunity and to secure the
fund into your possession, because being the chairman, I cannot do it alone
without the help of a foreigner who
will stand as the contractor who
executed the job.

Please
you should keep the business very secret and confidential to yourself, do not
tell anybody even your wife or your children till the money gets to your
account, then I will join you in your country for a meeting and subsequent,
introduce me into a profitable business where I  will invest my own share
of the fund.

I have
set aside 100% to be shared between me and you. I being the contract awarding
committee chairman, I will get 50%, you that is assisting me will get 40% then
10% will be shared between both parties for any expenses we may meet on th e
way during the transaction.
Please keep it very secret and
confidential to yourself, awaiting your urgent response for us to proceed. you
can contact me chuaernest_office@yahoo.com

YOUR
PHONE NUMBER, FAX NUMBER

YOU HOME
ADDRESS AND COMPANY ADDRESS

YOUR
ACCONUT NUMBER
YOUR FULL NAME
God bless.

Best
regards

NAME
CHUA ERNESTO

the Philippines. What's it like where you live?

Eliza Dane

messages.body:
Mr Ernesto,

I gave you my phone number on the express
understanding that you shouldn't use it as it is not secure as far as taking
calls, and I can't call you from that number (the phone is PIN-locked thanx to
Sophie's calling of friends interstate and not hanging up). If you couldn't get
through, then be grateful for bad connections at your end. It would have been
adios for any chance of secrecy.

If you didn't understand my last message,
it's down to this Mr Christ. I simply ask about "the status of box
UT6011JKI, containing various personal effects" and straightaway he's
asking me for ID so he can send me the box.

If he's prepared to give the box to me just
as soon as I send him my name, address, phone number and a copy of my passport
(which is not allowed BTW), then maybe you'd better find a safer place for that
money! 

Tell me when you find out what's happening,
this has been drawn out too much so for my liking.

Eliza Dane

Mr Ernesto,

What the hell is this obsession with urgency now? Is the trunk going to turn into a fucking pumpkin if we don't get it out by midnight? Be serious!

I don't like being patronised, so stop being such a jerk. I know this is serious. But since you also said that this business is 100% risk-free, I am trying to keep it that way. The real issue here is not me. It's Mr Christ's recalcitrance, and your hysteria. 

Eliza Dane

messages.body:
Mr Ernesto,

Let me make this clear
– I am not trying to hurt anyone, unless asking for reasonable treatment
is deemed some form of assault. I'm not the one to blame if Mr Christ is some
spoiled brat prima donna wussbag.

That aside – I
need to be absolutely sure of a few things before I finalise my bookings. I
need to know where the security company is (I'd like to book accommodation
somewhere nearby), and what arrangements I have to make about the money. The
reason I ask is that we are talking about $20 million – assuming it's in
$100 bills, that's about 200 kilos weight of notes, which is more than I can
carry. Even if I just carry my share, that's 40 kilos – still quite a
weight. What do we do then? Am I supposed to lug a big bag of cash back home?
Are you going to do that? We really have to plan ahead. Let me know the address
in London, and what we do when we're there.

Eliza Dane

Dr Adams:

I'm a little puzzled by your insistence
that " ahve  to follow our advice and instruction" on my
travels in England. You are the custodians of my belongings, not my personal
guardians. 

We intend to arrive in London, hire a car
and make our way to Manchester, where we'll book our own accommodation.

that score, you'd better confirm your actual address, as so far Mr Christ's
info was totally inadequate.

There's the matter of the fee - speaking
plainly, it's unbelievable that you could even for an instant consider charging
£12,000 - half the yearly average wage here - for a single box to be brought to
England. I want a full accounting
of this charge, and I mean every detail. 

Regards,

Eliza Dane

Dear Madam,

This is to confirm the receipt of your mail. Yes we are the custodian to your consignment and it is our duty to deliver it to you safely without any problem. We are just trying to advice and to cut down cost for you. But since you prefer to get to <?xml:namespace prefix = st1 ns = "urn:schemas-microsoft-com:office:smarttags" />London first and take a chartered vehicle to Manchester, there is no problem at all. We were as well trying to make things easier for you that is why we said that we will provide a vehicle that will pick you up from the airport in Manchester. But since this is not okay by you, you can proceed yourself. 

But it is paramount that you have to call us as soon as you have arrived London and at the same time you have to furnish us with the hotel name that you have made arrangement to stay so that we can send the driver to pick you up to our diplomatic house where this your consignment will be delivered to you .We are not in the position to disclose the address to you because of security reasons based on the fact that we handle so much valuables of consignment there in our storage. But upon your arrival here in the United Kingdom, we will definitely attend to you. 

This is our protocol of operation that we have been using to attend to various and numerous beneficiary and yours is not going to be different.

We are not in the position to start negotiating the charges of Twelve thousand British pounds sterling with you and it is none of our business if these charges are half the yearly average wages in your country. This charges covers the shipping and clearing/custom charges. 

And it is compulsory that you come along with it. If not there is nothing we can do. We cannot release your consignment to you with out it.

We are here to serve you and to make things very easy for you.

Thank you very much for your anticipated co-operation.

Yours Faithfully,

Dr. Peter Adams.

messages.body:
24 February 07

Attn: Eliza Dane.

Dear madam,

I received your mail message and the content was well noted.

However, I want you to understand that as much as we are diplomats, we have different positions.

Actually I am a diplomat but I was appointed as the chief delivery officer who is incharge of the delivery of your consignment attached with other consignments,so therefore  is right.

Secondly, I want you to understand that the reason why the charges are high is because, this consignment was tagged a diplomatic non-inspection article, so it has cost us money to cover for the non-inspection fee to permit easy passing of the consignment through the international Airports in order to avoid consignment confiscation.

Thirdly, the exact size of your consignment is 68kg, I want you to send me your fax number so that I will be able to fax to you the copy of the airway bill ( despatch slip).

Regarding my passport,I want you to understand that our passport is deposited in the international Airport so I do not have it with me at the moment, this is our policy, it will be released to me at the point of re-departure.

Lastly, I want to inform you that your partner  has paid the sum of three thousand pound to us, so the balance charge is seven thousand pounds only.

You are requested to come down in person with a proper identification attached with the balance of the diplomatic handling and delivery charges in order to permit the release of your consignment to you. Please note that we have limited time at hand as we will be leaving to Saudi-Arabia for the delivery of other consignments.

Endeavour to send me your telephone contact details so that I can call you for a brief update.

Thanks for your understanding.

Yours in service,

Mr. Jonathan Mark.

Chief delivery officer.

sidetalks a lot". WTF?

I do not get bad impressions from people. I get bad impressions from
bad things happening to me. 

I get more bad impressions when it looks like I'm going to maybe have
the same things happening, only worse this time.

I do remember how you got your money – you cheated your
government out of it. Do you think my memory's that bad? I may be blonde but
I'm not dumb.

I don't have pity on you because to date you haven't been arrested, and
you haven't come near to losing everything you cared about. 

I doubt you because so much of this doesn't make sense. 's lie
about the size of the shipment and the misgivings I had about the whole set-up

knowing you. It was the worst time of my life. I hope whoever you find fucks
you over big time. I'll be cheering him on.

Don't bother writing to me again. I won't tell the Feds – I was
trying to launder money, remember – but I wouldn't spit on you if you
were on fire.
